title: The NBA’s New Normal in China
text:
China, the biggest international market for the National Basketball Association, greeted the start of a new season with media blackouts, missing sponsors and airbrushed images.

During the first week of the NBA season, Chinese broadcasters ignored key games, including Thursday’s opener of the hugely popular Houston Rockets. For other matchups, the NBA’s media partners limited coverage to text play-by-play or modified it in other ways that combined to reduce the league’s connection to a fan base it claims to be 600 million people....
description: The Houston Rockets played their first game of the season. Chinese state TV broadcast Military World Games basketball instead. After media blackouts and protests, what happens next for the NBA?
